title: rel01.0: Core Storage with SQLite Backend
description: Implement the Cupboard and Table interfaces with SQLite backend. Covers use cases uc001-uc005: Cupboard lifecycle, Table CRUD, Crumb state machine, scaffolding validation, and benchmarks. Target: ~5000-6000 LOC of production Go code.

title: Entity types, interfaces, and errors
description:
Foundation types that everything else depends on. COMPLETED.

Package layout follows work-items.md separation of concerns:
- pkg/api/ — Pure interfaces (Cupboard, Table), Config, SQLiteConfig, API-level errors
- pkg/schema/ — Entity structs with in-memory domain logic, entity-level errors
- pkg/constants/ — All domain constants (states, link types, table names, etc.)

## Files Created
- pkg/api/cupboard.go (Cupboard + Table interfaces)
- pkg/api/config.go (Config + SQLiteConfig structs with validation)
- pkg/api/errors.go (API-level errors: config, lifecycle, table operation)
- pkg/schema/crumb.go (Crumb struct + SetState/Pebble/Dust/property methods)
- pkg/schema/trail.go (Trail struct + Complete/Abandon methods)
- pkg/schema/stash.go (Stash struct + SetValue/Increment/Acquire/Release)
- pkg/schema/entities.go (Property, Category, Link, Metadata, StashHistoryEntry, Schema)
- pkg/schema/errors.go (entity-level errors: state, transition, property, lock)
- pkg/constants/constants.go (all domain string constants)

title: Benchmarks for uc005
description:
Performance baselines for Table operations at various scales.

## Requirements
- Benchmark Get at 10, 100, 1000, 10000 crumbs
- Benchmark Set (create) at 10, 1000 crumbs
- Benchmark Set (update) at 10, 1000 crumbs
- Benchmark Delete at 10, 1000 crumbs
- Benchmark Fetch all at 100, 1000 crumbs
- Benchmark Fetch by state at 100, 1000 crumbs
- Measure: ns/op, B/op, allocs/op
- Use b.ResetTimer() after setup
- Each benchmark uses fresh temp directory

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0.yaml (uc005 test cases)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc005-crumbs-table-benchmarks.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/engine/bench_test.go (all benchmark functions)

## Acceptance Criteria
- go test -bench=. -benchmem ./internal/persistence/engine/ runs all benchmarks
- Benchmarks cover Get, Set (create/update), Delete, Fetch (all/filtered)
- Each scale (10/100/1000/10000) has its own sub-benchmark
- Results include ns/op, B/op, allocs/op

title: SQLite schema and JSONL engine
description:
Database schema creation and JSONL file I/O — the storage foundation.

## Requirements
- Backend struct with sync.RWMutex, attached state, config, db handle, tables map
- NewBackend() constructor
- SQLite schema: CREATE TABLE for crumbs, trails, links, properties, categories, crumb_properties, metadata, stashes, stash_history
- Indexes: idx_crumbs_state, idx_trails_state, idx_links_type_from, idx_links_type_to, etc.
- JSONL read: parse one JSON object per line, skip empty/malformed lines
- JSONL write: atomic (temp file → fsync → rename)
- Sync strategy: immediate (default), on_close, batch with configurable BatchSize/BatchInterval

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R1-R4, R16)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/engine/backend.go (Backend struct, NewBackend)
- internal/persistence/engine/schema.go (CREATE TABLE + INDEX SQL)
- internal/persistence/engine/jsonl.go (read/write/atomic-persist JSONL)
- internal/persistence/engine/config.go (sync strategy handling)
- go.mod (add modernc.org/sqlite dependency)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Schema creates all 9 tables with correct columns
- All indexes created per R3.3
- JSONL reader handles empty lines, malformed JSON gracefully
- JSONL writer uses atomic rename pattern
- Sync strategies configurable via SQLiteConfig

title: Entity hydration and dehydration
description:
Convert between Go entity structs and SQLite rows / JSONL lines.

## Requirements
- Hydration: SQLite row → entity struct for all 7 entity types + crumb_properties
- Dehydration: entity struct → SQL parameters + JSONL JSON for all types
- Time fields: RFC 3339 strings ↔ time.Time
- Nullable columns: pointer types or zero values
- Stash.Value: JSON encode/decode
- crumb_properties.value: JSON-encoded for all types

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R14, R15)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/mapping/hydrate.go (row → entity for all types)
- internal/persistence/mapping/dehydrate.go (entity → row/JSONL for all types)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Round-trip fidelity: hydrate(dehydrate(entity)) == entity for all types
- Time parsing handles RFC 3339 with timezone
- NULL columns hydrate to nil pointers
- Stash.Value JSON round-trips correctly

title: Backend lifecycle (Attach/Detach) and table routing
description:
The startup/shutdown sequence and table name resolution.

## Requirements
- Attach: create DataDir if not exists, create empty JSONL files, delete old cupboard.db, create schema, load JSONL into SQLite (transactional), validate FK relationships
- Attach idempotent: returns ErrAlreadyAttached if called twice
- Detach: wait for in-flight ops, verify JSONL current, close SQLite
- Detach idempotent: multiple calls don't error
- After Detach: all ops return ErrCupboardDetached
- GetTable routing: crumbs→Crumb, trails→Trail, properties→Property, metadata→Metadata, links→Link, stashes→Stash
- GetTable returns ErrTableNotFound for unrecognized names
- Table accessors created once during Attach, reused

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R4-R6)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R4, R6, R11-R12)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc001-cupboard-lifecycle.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/engine/backend.go (Attach, Detach, GetTable implementation)
- internal/persistence/engine/loader.go (JSONL → SQLite loading, transactional, skip malformed)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Attach creates directory and files from scratch
- Attach loads existing JSONL data into SQLite
- Malformed JSONL lines skipped with warning
- ErrAlreadyAttached on double-attach
- ErrCupboardDetached after detach
- GetTable returns correct table for all 6 standard names

title: Table Get/Set/Delete/Fetch implementation
description:
The core CRUD operations that all commands use.

## Requirements
- Get: query SQLite by PK, hydrate row to entity struct, return or ErrNotFound
- Set: type-assert entity, generate UUID v7 if empty ID, validate (e.g. Name non-empty for Crumb), dehydrate to row, INSERT or UPDATE, persist to JSONL
- Delete: delete from SQLite by PK, persist to JSONL, ErrNotFound if not exists
- Fetch: build SQL WHERE from filter map, query SQLite, hydrate rows, return []any
- Filter keys: states, trail_id, parent_id, properties, limit, offset (for crumbs); entity-specific filters for other tables
- Results ordered by CreatedAt descending
- Single-writer, multiple-reader concurrency (R8)
- Set determines INSERT vs UPDATE by checking row existence

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R3)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R5, R8, R13)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-crumbs-interface.yaml (R3, R6-R10)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc002-table-crud.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/engine/table.go (Table impl: Get, Set, Delete, Fetch for all entity types)
- internal/persistence/engine/filter.go (filter map → SQL WHERE clause builder)
- go.mod (add github.com/google/uuid for UUID v7)

## Acceptance Criteria
- CRUD works for all 6 standard tables (crumbs, trails, properties, metadata, links, stashes)
- Set with empty ID generates UUID v7 and creates new entity
- Set with existing ID updates entity
- Delete removes entity and returns ErrNotFound for missing
- Fetch with empty filter returns all entities
- Fetch respects limit/offset
- Concurrent reads don't block each other
- Writes are serialized

title: Trail cascades, built-in properties, graph audit
description:
Domain-specific behaviors triggered by Set operations and startup.

## Requirements
- Trail complete cascade: when trail state changes to "completed", remove all belongs_to links (crumbs become permanent)
- Trail abandon cascade: when trail state changes to "abandoned", delete all crumbs that belong to it + their properties, metadata, and links
- Cascade triggered by detecting state change during Set (R5.6, R5.7)
- Built-in property seeding on first startup (empty properties.jsonl): priority (categorical), type (categorical), description (text), owner (text), labels (list)
- Built-in categories: priority (highest/high/medium/low/lowest), type (task/epic/bug/chore)
- Crumb property initialization: on creation, all defined properties initialized with type-based defaults
- Graph audit: ValidateDAG (cycle detection), ValidateReferences (link targets exist), ValidateBelongsTo, ValidateBranchesFrom, ValidateScopedTo, ValidateTrailCrumbs
- Audit runs on startup after loading; Attach returns error if validation fails

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R5.6-R5.7, R9, R10)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-crumbs-interface.yaml (R3)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd004-properties-interface.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/engine/cascade.go (trail complete/abandon cascade logic)
- internal/persistence/engine/seed.go (built-in properties + categories seeding)
- internal/persistence/engine/audit.go (graph validation functions)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Completing a trail removes belongs_to links, crumbs persist
- Abandoning a trail deletes crumbs, properties, metadata, links
- Built-in properties seeded on first Attach with empty DB
- Not re-seeded on subsequent Attach
- Crumb creation initializes all properties with defaults
- Audit detects cycles, broken references

title: CLI foundation and generic table commands
description:
cobra/viper setup, global flags, and the generic get/set/delete/list commands.

## Requirements
- cobra root command with global flags: --config-dir, --data-dir, --help, --version
- viper config loading: platform defaults, env overrides (CRUMBS_CONFIG_DIR), flag overrides, config.yaml
- cupboard init: create data dir, JSONL files, seed properties, print success message
- cupboard version: print version string
- cupboard get <table> <id>: retrieve entity, JSON output, exit 0/1
- cupboard set <table> <id> <json>: create/update entity, JSON output, exit 0/1
- cupboard delete <table> <id>: remove entity, confirmation output, exit 0/1
- cupboard list <table> [key=value...]: query with filters, JSON array output, exit 0/1
- Output formatting: human-readable (tabwriter) default, JSON (--json flag), 2-space indent
- Error messages to stderr, output to stdout
- Exit codes: 0 (success), 1 (user error), 2 (system error)

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R1-R3, R6-R10)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd010-configuration-directories.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/main.go (rewrite with cobra root)
- cmd/cupboard/cmd/root.go (global flags, config loading)
- cmd/cupboard/cmd/generic.go (get, set, delete, list commands)
- cmd/cupboard/cmd/version.go (version command)
- cmd/cupboard/output/format.go (human + JSON output formatting)
- go.mod (add cobra, viper dependencies)

## Acceptance Criteria
- cupboard version prints version
- cupboard init creates data directory and files
- cupboard set crumbs "" '{"Name":"test"}' creates a crumb and outputs JSON
- cupboard get crumbs <id> retrieves it
- cupboard list crumbs returns JSON array
- cupboard delete crumbs <id> removes it
- --json flag works on all commands
- Errors go to stderr with contextual messages

title: CLI crumb and issue-tracking commands
description:
Entity-specific and issue-tracking CLI commands.

## Requirements
- cupboard crumb add --name <name> [--state <state>] [--json]
- cupboard crumb get <id> [--json] (human-readable table default)
- cupboard crumb list [--state <state>] [--limit <n>] [--json] (shows Total: N)
- cupboard crumb delete <id> [--json]
- cupboard ready [-n <count>] [--type <type>] [--json] (lists state=ready crumbs)
- cupboard create --type <type> --title <title> [--description <text>] [--json]
- cupboard show <id> [--json] (same as crumb get)
- cupboard update <id> [--status <state>] [--title <title>] [--json]
- cupboard close <id> [--json] (transitions to pebble)
- cupboard comments add <id> <text> (adds metadata entry)

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R4, R5)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/cmd/crumb.go (crumb add/get/list/delete subcommands)
- cmd/cupboard/cmd/tracking.go (ready, create, show, update, close, comments)
- cmd/cupboard/output/format.go (crumb-specific display formatting)

## Acceptance Criteria
- cupboard crumb add --name "Test" creates crumb in draft state
- cupboard crumb list --state draft shows crumbs in table format
- cupboard ready shows crumbs with state=ready
- cupboard create --type task --title "Test" creates crumb with type property
- cupboard close <id> transitions to pebble state
- cupboard comments add <id> "note" creates metadata entry
- All commands support --json flag

title: Integration tests for uc001-uc004
description:
Tests validating Cupboard lifecycle, Table CRUD, Crumb state machine, and scaffolding.

## Requirements
- Cupboard lifecycle tests (uc001): Config validation, Attach/Detach, GetTable, error handling, ErrAlreadyAttached, ErrCupboardDetached
- Table CRUD tests (uc002): Get/Set/Delete/Fetch for all 6 standard tables, UUID v7 generation, JSONL persistence, round-trip fidelity, filtering
- Crumb state machine tests (uc003): SetState transitions (draft→pending→ready→taken→pebble), Pebble requires taken, Dust from any state, UpdatedAt tracking, state-based Fetch filtering
- Scaffolding validation tests (uc004): go build succeeds, CLI version command works, entity struct fields match PRDs, interface contracts satisfied

## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0.yaml (test cases for uc001-uc004)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc001-cupboard-lifecycle.yaml
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc002-table-crud.yaml
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc003-crumb-lifecycle.yaml
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc004-scaffolding-validation.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/persistence/engine/backend_test.go (Cupboard lifecycle tests)
- internal/persistence/engine/table_test.go (Table CRUD tests for all entity types)
- internal/persistence/mapping/mapping_test.go (hydration/dehydration round-trip tests)
- pkg/schema/crumb_test.go (Crumb state machine unit tests)
- pkg/schema/trail_test.go (Trail state machine unit tests)
- go.mod (add github.com/stretchr/testify)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All test cases from test-rel01.0.yaml uc001-uc004 sections pass
- go test ./... passes with 0 failures
- Tests use t.TempDir() for isolation
- Tests cover error paths (not found, invalid state, detached)
